Vector derivatives in orthogonal coordinates

Given an orthogonal coordinate system \({u,v,w}\) with unit vectors \(\underline{\hat{u}}\), \(\underline{\hat{v}}\) and \(\underline{\hat{w}}\) and scale factors, \(h_u\), \(h_v\) and \(h_w\), it is possible to find the derivatives \({\underline \nabla} f\), \({\underline \nabla} \cdot \underline{F}\) and \({\underline \nabla} \times \underline{F}\). It is found that
\[ \begin{aligned} \mbox{grad} \displaystyle f &= {\underline \nabla} f = \frac{1}{h_u} \frac{\partial f}{\partial u} \underline{\hat{u}} + \frac{1}{h_v} \frac{\partial f}{\partial v} \underline{\hat{v}} + \frac{1}{h_w} \frac{\partial f}{\partial w} \underline{\hat{w}}\\ \mbox{If} \quad \underline{F} &= F_u \underline{\hat{u}} + F_v \underline{\hat{v}} + F_w \underline{\hat{w}}\quad \mbox{then} \\ \mbox{div} \displaystyle \underline{F} &= {\underline \nabla} \cdot \underline{F} = \frac{1}{h_u h_v h_w} \left[ \frac{\partial}{\partial u}(F_u h_v h_w) + \frac{\partial}{\partial v}(F_v h_u h_w) + \frac{\partial}{\partial w}(F_w h_u h_v) \right] \\ \mbox{Also if} \quad\underline{F} &= F_u \underline{\hat{u}} + F_v \underline{\hat{v}} + F_w \underline{\hat{w}}\quad \mbox{then} \\ \mbox{curl} \displaystyle \underline{F} &= {\underline \nabla} \times \displaystyle \underline{F} = \frac{1}{h_u h_v h_w} \left|\begin{array}{ccc} h_u \underline{\hat{u}} & h_v \underline{\hat{v}} & h_w \underline{\hat{w}} \\ \\ \displaystyle \frac{\partial}{\partial u} & \displaystyle \frac{\partial}{\partial v} & \displaystyle \frac{\partial}{\partial w} \\ \\ h_u F_u & h_v F_v & h_w F_w \end{array} \right| \end{aligned} \]

Key Point

In orthogonal curvilinear coordinates, the vector derivatives \(\underline{\nabla}f \), \(\underline{\nabla} \cdot \underline{F}\) and \(\underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F}\) include the scale factors \(h_u\), \(h_v\) and \(h_w\)
